title: bitcoinbass
author: bitcoinbass
content: Hello everyone, Recently it came my way a 5BTC Holo 2012 (MS67) and i was wondering, whats the market price for such coin now a days?I haven't seen any 5btc holo coins offered for sale in the forum so does anyone have any idea? It's a rare piece and i consider my self really lucky to even have one in hand. The coin itself is in great condition.More information about the total number of coins minted: https://casasciustracker.com/status/More: https://i.imgur.com/aXeumjf.jpghttps://i.imgur.com/V7iUzGd.jpgPictures courtesy of MJ.Thanks

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body:
They don’t appear often with holo/key. I have only seen a few for sale in the last 3-4 years. Stacks recently had one in the June auction, but I don’t feel like they marketed it well pre-auction and then during poorly by the auctioneer. Some blanks sold for 2x what this one went for, so someone got a great deal. June 2023 Auction - Session 4 - Physical Cryptocurrency - Lots 4001-4168May 09, 2023Lot #: 4110Title: Redeemed 2012 Casascius "Bitnickel" 5 Bitcoin. Firstbits 1CtprxPF. Series 1. Nickel Plated Brass. MS-67 (ICG).Description: Exciting Redeemed Casascius 5 Bitcoin Rarity

The First Our Firm Has Handled

Redeemed 2012 Casascius "Bitnickel" 5 Bitcoin. Firstbits 1CtprxPF. Series 1. Nickel Plated Brass. MS-67 (ICG).

Redeemed and non-loaded. An incredibly exciting offering that represents the very first such example our firm has handled. This piece was initially funded with 5 BTC on February 13, 2012 and was redeemed just over a year later on February 23, 2013. At the time it was redeemed, the 5 BTC face value was equivalent to roughly US$150. Today, it would amount to about US$150,000 (May 2023).

A much more common unfunded example sold for $2,400 in our March 2023 sale, which never had any cryptocurrency associated with it. The present redeemed piece offers an immensely more fascinating narrative and greater rarity. It represents an irresistible jewel for advanced specialists.

According to researcher Elias Ahonen, the Series 1 Casascius 5 BTC funded coins were released in January 2012 with an issue price of 6 BTC, amounting to around US$33 at the time. Since their debut, nearly 35% of them have been peeled and redeemed. Public Address: 1CtprxPFwem1htFbNNfhvX2PRZxDrKLpEt.

PCGS# 893335.

comments.author: bitcoinbass
comments.body: Nice, Thanks for the above information wasn't aware about the coin, but indeed that coin was sold at a huge discount surprisingly and.. with MS67 grading.. Some notes here: 1) People can see the coin here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cvMRFSKQo5U - minute: 1:54:502) The one sold at the auction is a series 1 where the above is series 2. 3) Total issued series 1    675 & series 2 587.Honestly the series 2 looks way better than series 1 and it's even more rare.

comments.author: willi9974
comments.body: A very nice 5 BTC coin from Casascius, but I mean if the coins are spend / coins are unloaded, the value from this coin is not so much. But a very nice coin for a show room.Best regards,Willi

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: How much BTC would you want for this?

comments.author: rsincognito
comments.body: Maybe my eyes are bad and I’m not understanding , so the coin in the pic has been peeled ,  correct ?  Ty

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: Finding a peeled 5 Cas with holo/key is rare. I have only seen maybe one or two for sale here on the forum in years.  They are much more valuable than the common blanks, in my opinion. Quote from: willi9974 on July 09, 2023, 08:23:38 PMA very nice 5 BTC coin from Casascius, but I mean if the coins are spend / coins are unloaded, the value from this coin is not so much. But a very nice coin for a show room.Best regards,Willi

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Quote from: rsincognito on July 10, 2023, 03:48:21 AMMaybe my eyes are bad and I’m not understanding , so the coin in the pic has been peeled ,  correct ?  Ty Yes, it has been peeled. Classic signs of a destroyed hologram are seen on it. Honeycomb shape torn into the hologram and a peel point.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: I'd guess you could get $750-$1250 today on BT

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Rare piece of Bitcoin history. Personally I prefere to see the hologram as intact as possible even on peeled items.Any plans on going on auction with this one? Watching...

comments.author: bitcoinbass
comments.body: Quote from: willi9974 on July 09, 2023, 08:23:38 PMA very nice 5 BTC coin from Casascius, but I mean if the coins are spend / coins are unloaded, the value from this coin is not so much. But a very nice coin for a show room.Best regards,WilliIndeed a very nice rare piece! Personally I prefere to see the hologram as intact as possible even on peeled items.Any plans on going on auction with this one? Watching...The initial owner of this coin did try his best to keep the holo as intact as possible. I think he did a good job compared to other holos in the market. Quote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on July 10, 2023, 08:17:30 AMI'd guess you could get $750-$1250 today on BThaha, if you find 5BTC holo Series 2 at these prices , please send them my way will buy them all  Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on July 09, 2023, 09:14:21 PMHow much BTC would you want for this? Quote from: Kryptowerk on July 10, 2023, 02:06:04 PMRare piece of Bitcoin history. Personally I prefere to see the hologram as intact as possible even on peeled items.Any plans on going on auction with this one? Watching...Not for sale at the moment, Any upcoming auctions related to this coin will go through MJ so keep an eye at his auctions.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Put it up for sale and watch. Personally I wouldn't sell Casascius pieces right now. Market is to slow. A bunch of pieces are going cheap. Its a buyers market.

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: Cheap in dollar terms? Sure. But I wouldn't say anything is cheap right now in Bitcoin terms. I would make the bet that most Bitcoin collectibles will devalue in BTC terms this next cycle

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: If you want to sell- I’d sell it on eBay. Prob get way more. Set a high price or reserve. But Don’t sell to newer members , make sure they’ve got something like at least 2-3 years of being there with 5-10 positive feedback , no negatives.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: ChiBitcty is correct. You will get more on ebay. Always price high and allow offers.  FYI its still slow out there. If you sell on BT right now,  i'd stay at my original statement of $750-$1250usd or equal value in bitcoin.

comments.author: Hox
comments.body: One recently sold on ebay for ~$2,300 USD https://www.ebay.com/itm/334896662146?nordt=true&orig_cvip=true&rt=ncEdit: lol I just realised this was the same coin.

A bunch of pieces are going cheap. Its a buyers market. Quote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on July 11, 2023, 04:35:41 AMChiBitcty is correct. You will get more on ebay. Always price high and allow offers.  FYI its still slow out there. If you sell on BT right now,  i'd stay at my original statement of $750-$1250usd or equal value in bitcoin.For now i don't think it's worth to put it for sale, will do so when the market is more mature. I will agree that now is a buyer market (or maybe don't sell it at all), but again if you do find 5BTC holo around 750-1250 do let me know!   Quote from: ChiBitCTy on July 11, 2023, 04:00:20 AMIf you want to sell- I’d sell it on eBay. Prob get way more. Set a high price or reserve. But Don’t sell to newer members , make sure they’ve got something like at least 2-3 years of being there with 5-10 positive feedback , no negatives. I will agree that ebay might be a place to get a way higher price than the forum if you get lucky.(as you mentioned will be sold only to trusted users)Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on July 11, 2023, 02:39:36 AMCheap in dollar terms? Sure. But I wouldn't say anything is cheap right now in Bitcoin terms. I would make the bet that most Bitcoin collectibles will devalue in BTC terms this next cycle I am not really sure about that, remain to be seen. Now for everyone awareness @minerjones did give me an estimate price for the current value of the coin, i will let him justify his estimation on this thread so we all get a better understanding and to further discuss.Thanks -bass

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on July 11, 2023, 02:39:36 AMCheap in dollar terms? Sure. But I wouldn't say anything is cheap right now in Bitcoin terms. I would make the bet that most Bitcoin collectibles will devalue in BTC terms this next cycle I am not really sure about that, remain to be seen. Now for everyone awareness @minerjones did give me an estimate price for the current value of the coin, i will let him justify his estimation on this thread so we all get a better understanding and to further discuss.Thanks -bass[/quote]"remain to be seen". I mean you can search "Casascius" in the search bar at the top right of this forum and you will see the premiums from 2013-2017 and then compare them with the premiums of today.Ungraded Brass Casascius coins were selling for 3-5 BTC. Today you'd be lucky to get 1.3 BTC.Dollars premiums going up, BTCitcoin premiums are trending down.The trend is your friend.

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: I have a few redeemed 5 BTC series 1 with holos/keys still attached if anyone is interested. All PCGS graded. Always open to offers/trades. They don't surface often.

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: Quote from: Spokanistan51 on July 13, 2023, 03:45:19 PMI have a few redeemed 5 BTC series 1 with holos/keys still attached if anyone is interested. All PCGS graded. Always open to offers/trades. They don't surface often.Depending on how they look I would be interested. Any photos?
